item.content:encoded: Image: Obsidian Entertainment Studio shut down wraps a big year of layoffs in gaming Versus Evil, the indie game publisher behind Stoic Studio‚Äôs The Banner Saga and Obsidian Entertainment‚Äôs Pillars of Eternity, announced Friday it was shutting down after a decade in business. Versus Evil‚Äôs entire staff has been laid off just days before Christmas ‚Äî and the day after Atari announced a $2 million investment in Versus Evil parent company tinyBuild. ‚ÄúToday is a sad day,‚Äù Versus Evil said on its X ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo The N64 classic inspired today‚Äôs open-world games, but couldn‚Äôt be more different from them There were few moments as iconic, during the birth phase of 3D gaming, as the first time Link stepped onto Hyrule Field in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time. item.content:encoded: Image: Charlie Hall/Polygon | Source: Various The growing popularity of solo tabletop experiences shows fun doesn‚Äôt have to be shared The year 2020 was an interesting one for our planet, and an incredibly boring one for me personally. By day I was working remotely from my apartment, managing one of the pop-up shelters created by the U.K. government for its unhoused population. By night I was locked away in my bedroom-come-office staring at the same few glowing screens and in desperate need of ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Logitech The pricey Astro A50X lets you connect and seamlessly switch between up to three HDMI inputs. At least once per year we‚Äôre treated to incremental upgrades in headset designs from manufacturers like Razer, Steelseries, and HyperX. These improvements typically touch on some of the more objective points of their peripherals, like audio quality and battery life. However, the latest headset model from Logitech, the Astro A50X, is offering something a bit more drastic. In addition to...

item.content:encoded: Image: Rockstar Games Rockstar spent $5 million to recover from the hack Arion Kurtaj, the 18-year-old hacker responsible for the infamous Grand Theft Auto 6 leak from last year, was sentenced to indefinite custody at a ‚Äúsecure hospital,‚Äù according to the BBC. item.title: Evaluating Methods for Calculating Document Similarity | KDnuggets
item.description: The blog covers methods for representing documents as vectors and computing similarity, such as Jaccard similarity, Euclidean distance, cosine similarity, and cosine similarity with TF-IDF, along with...
item.content:encoded: The blog covers methods for representing documents as vectors and computing similarity, such as Jaccard similarity, Euclidean distance, cosine similarity, and cosine similarity with TF-IDF, along with pre-processing steps for text data, such as tokenization, lowercasing, removing punctuation, removing stop words, and lemmatization.

item.description: Posted by Dan Kondratyuk and David Ross, Software Engineers, Google Research A recent wave of video generation models has burst onto the scene, in many cases showcasing stunning picturesque qualit...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Dan Kondratyuk and David Ross, Software Engineers, Google Research A recent wave of video generation models has burst onto the scene, in many cases showcasing stunning picturesque quality. One of the current bottlenecks in video generation is in the ability to produce coherent large motions. In many cases, even the current leading models either generate small motion or, when producing larger motions, exhibit noticeable artifacts. To explore the application of language models in vi...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Yechen Li and Neha Arora, Software Engineers, Google Research Fifteen minutes. That‚Äôs how long it took to empty the Colosseum, an engineering marvel that‚Äôs still standing as the largest amphitheater in the world. Two thousand years later, this design continues to work well to move enormous crowds out of sporting and entertainment venues. But of course, exiting the arena is only the first step. Next, people must navigate the traffic that builds up in the surrounding streets. Th...

item.title: Advancements in machine learning for machine learning | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Phitchaya Mangpo Phothilimthana, Staff Research Scientist, Google DeepMind, and Bryan Perozzi, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Research With the recent and accelerated advances ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Phitchaya Mangpo Phothilimthana, Staff Research Scientist, Google DeepMind, and Bryan Perozzi, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Research With the recent and accelerated advances in machine learning (ML), machines can understand natural language, engage in conversations, draw images, create videos and more. Modern ML models are programmed and trained using ML programming frameworks, such as TensorFlow, JAX, PyTorch, among many others. These libraries provide high-level instr...

item.title: StyleDrop: Text-to-image generation in any style | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Kihyuk Sohn and Dilip Krishnan, Research Scientists, Google Research Text-to-image models trained on large volumes of image-text pairs have enabled the creation of rich and diverse image...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Kihyuk Sohn and Dilip Krishnan, Research Scientists, Google Research Text-to-image models trained on large volumes of image-text pairs have enabled the creation of rich and diverse images encompassing many genres and themes. Moreover, popular styles such as ‚Äúanime‚Äù or ‚Äústeampunk‚Äù, when added to the input text prompt, may translate to specific visual outputs. While many efforts have been put into prompt engineering, a wide range of styles are simply hard to describe in text form due...

item.description: Chain of Code is an approach to interacting with language models, enhancing reasoning abilities through a blend of writing, executing, and simulating code execution, extending the capabilities of lang...
item.content:encoded: Chain of Code is an approach to interacting with language models, enhancing reasoning abilities through a blend of writing, executing, and simulating code execution, extending the capabilities of language models in logic, arithmetic, and linguistic tasks, especially those requiring a combination of these.

item.description: In a paper published in Nature, we introduce FunSearch, a method for searching for ‚Äúfunctions‚Äù written in computer code, and find new solutions in mathematics and computer science. FunSearch works by ...
item.content:encoded: In a paper published in Nature, we introduce FunSearch, a method for searching for ‚Äúfunctions‚Äù written in computer code, and find new solutions in mathematics and computer science. FunSearch works by pairing a pre-trained LLM, whose goal is to provide creative solutions in the form of computer code, with an automated ‚Äúevaluator‚Äù, which guards against hallucinations and incorrect ideas.

item.description: Posted by Catherine Armato, Program Manager, Google This week the 37th annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS 2023), the biggest machine learning conference of the yea...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Catherine Armato, Program Manager, Google This week the 37th annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS 2023), the biggest machine learning conference of the year, kicks off in New Orleans, LA. Google is proud to be a Diamond Level sponsor of NeurIPS this year and will have a strong presence with >170 accepted papers, two keynote talks, and additional contributions to the broader research community through organizational support and involvement in >20 works...
